intro: Selinum creticum, commonly known as rock garlic, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, hollow stems and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are fern-like and can be used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Selinum creticum is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
